txt.en: 'Look for Ultan Foebane at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree, in Bree-land.'
Talk to Derwent Bindweed outside the Bree Jail
'You are a champion's champion, [placeholder], and I don't mind saying so!'
Talk to Derwent Bindweed and help him with his problem
'You have proven yourself to me, and to your opponents as well!'
Derwent Bindweed is somewhere outside the Bree Jail, waiting for someone to help him with a tricky situation.
Derwent Bindweed is somewhere outside the Bree Jail, waiting for someone to help him with a tricky situation.

'Are you... here to help me? I have gotten myself into something of a tight spot and don't know how to get out of it!

'You see, I have been working up at Thornley's Work Site for the past few weeks, and some unsavoury characters have been pressuring me to pay them a portion of my wages. I managed to put them off a few days, but if I don't do it soon I'm afraid they might come after my family! They demanded that I meet them at the old ruins in the southern part of town, after dark, and I don't know what to do!

'You look like you might be pretty good in a fight. Do you think you could come with me to the meeting, and maybe stand around and look serious? I don't want anyone to get hurt, but maybe the sight of you will convince them to leave me alone. What do you say?'

'There's a Man here in Bree who goes by the name Derwent Bindweed, and he's in a bit of a tight spot. Find him outside the jail and help him as you can. Seems to me his trouble could best be solved with a bit of skilful brawling, and mayhap you'll show the naysayers something of our true quality!\n\n'You're bound to learn something, too, and what Brawler doesn't like a bit of extra oomph to go with every swing?'
Brawlers have a reputation throughout the lands of Middle-earth for always being in the thick of trouble, but sometimes they can prevent worse trouble simply by showing up.
Derwent Bindweed is outside the Bree Jail.

'Oh, thank you so much! With you standing beside me, they won't dare try anything!'

<rgb=#FF0000>This is a Solo quest, and cannot be completed with a Fellowship.</rgb>

'I guess I was wrong, [placeholder]. The threat of a good punch might sometimes be enough... but occasionally the punches themselves might be necessary too!

'Still, I think it might be time for my family to find a new home. I don't think Bill Ferny is likely to leave us alone, even with you nearby to knock some sense into his fellows! I'll tell Robb Thornley he'll need to find someone else. It might slow down progress at his work site, but there's nothing for it.

'Be sure to tell the dwarf I spoke with that he chose just the right Brawler to help me! I really appreciate it, [placeholder]. Perhaps I will see you again.'

'A champion is happiest in battle, [placeholder], protecting the weak and fighting for the helpless. I can see in your eye that you have already come to understand that. Now you need to hone your skills so that you may survive the difficulties this calling will set before you!

'There is a mighty champion, a dwarf by the name of Ultan Foebane, who is sure to give you some advice to help you become even stronger, if you can prove that you are worthy of being called a champion. I know that you can prove this to him, [placeholder].

'As I heard it, Ultan Foebane was looking for adventurers at the Combe-gate, on the eastern side of the town of Bree. Present yourself to him and be ready to prove yourself a champion!'

'We Brawlers have something of a reputation, [placeholder]. Folk say where there's trouble, you're likely to find one of us making things worse! Well, I say that's unfair! Some of the time we make things better, don't we? We do!

'Whisper has reached my ears of just such an occurrence. There's a Man here in Bree who goes by the name Derwent Bindweed, and he's in a bit of a tight spot. Find him outside the Bree Jail and help him as you can. Seems to me his trouble could best be solved with a bit of skilful brawling, and mayhap you'll show the naysayers something of our true quality!

'You're bound to learn something, too, and what Brawler doesn't like a bit of extra oomph to go with every swing?'
Brom Hawksbeard is in the Bree Jail.

'A champion is happiest in battle, [placeholder], protecting the weak and fighting for the helpless. I can see in your eye that you have already come to understand that. Now you need to hone your skills so you may survive the difficulties this calling will set before you!

'There is a mighty champion, a dwarf by the name of Ultan Foebane, who is sure to give you some advice to help you become even stronger, if you can prove that you are worthy of being called a champion. I know that you can prove this to him, [placeholder].

'As I heard it, Ultan Foebane was looking for adventurers at the Combe-gate, on the eastern side of town of Bree. Present yourself to him and be ready to prove yourself a champion!'

'You showed those ruffians not to tangle with a Brawler, did you? Ha! Serves them right, and may they remember it! Of course, if you hit them as hard as it sounds like you did, they might not remember the lesson at all....\n\n'In any case, you made me proud, [placeholder]! Take this reward and keep on preventing trouble... or causing it!'

'A champion is happiest in battle, [placeholder], protecting the weak and fighting for the helpless. I can see in your eye that you have already come to understand that. Now you need to hone your skills so you may survive the difficulties this calling will set before you!

'DNT - Blah!'

The name of a champion goes before him, carried on the wind by those for whom he fights. It cows his enemies and lifts the hearts of good people everywhere.

Ultan Foebane is at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree.\n\nYou have been told to speak with Ultan Foebane, a mighty champion travelling through the Bree-land, for the dwarf may be able to help you become stronger.

Ultan Foebane has given you a list containing the locations of three deadly enemies to dispatch.\n\nTo prove you are a worthy champion, Ultan Foebane has tasked you with slaying three threats to the folk of Bree-land.

Ultan Foebane is at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree.\n\nYou have defeated the three opponents that Ultan Foebane challenged you to best and should now return in victory to the dwarf.

'A champion is happiest in battle, [placeholder], protecting the weak and fighting for the helpless. I can see in your eye that you have already come to understand that. Now you need to hone your skills so that you may survive the difficulties this calling will set before you!

'As I heard it, Ultan Foebane was looking for adventurers at the Combe-gate, on the eastern side of the town of Bree. Present yourself to him and be ready to prove yourself a champion!'
'I gave you my notes on the locations of three deadly foes, [placeholder]. Dispatch these opponents and return and I will give you some small measure of training! Are you a champion or are you not?'

'A champion is happiest in battle, [placeholder], protecting the weak and fighting for the helpless. I can see in your eye that you have already come to understand that. Now you need to hone your skills so that you may survive the difficulties this calling will set before you!

'As I heard it, Ultan Foebane was looking for adventurers at the Combe-gate, on the eastern side of the town of Bree. Present yourself to him and be ready to prove yourself a champion!'
'Look for Ultan Foebane at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree. He has been looking for stalwart champions whose mettle he can test ever since he came to Bree-land.'

'Look for Ultan Foebane at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree, in Bree-land.'

'You say you're a champion, [placeholder], but I have to tell you that I've never heard of you. What great deeds have you performed? None that I have seen, and still there is great danger in the surrounding countryside!

'I will recognize you as a champion only if you can slay three of the evils that threaten this town of Men. I give you their names and their favourite haunts and ask only that you end them and return to me!

'With the use of these notes, a real champion would be able to bring safety to these lands and inspire the people with word of his deeds.'
'Look for Ultan Foebane at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree, in Bree-land.'

'News of your battles come before you, [placeholder], for the whole town speaks of them!

'Zhurpukh of the Deeps will no more sneak from the marshes in search of open windows and unlatched doors! Fair Sherman? More lovely in death, they say! And of Morley the Fierce, the people say only this -- that he was not fierce enough to best [placeholder], a worthy champion indeed!

'The people in this town of Men speak the truth, friend champion. I will give you some measure of instruction in the fighting arts, the better to improve the strikes you make at your enemies!'
'Look for Ultan Foebane at the Combe-gate on the east side of the town of Bree, in Bree-land.'
